verses.text: Then God said to him in the dream, “Yes, I know that in the integrity of your heart you have done this, and I also kept you from sinning against Me; therefore I did not let you touch her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, restore the man’s wife, for he is a prophet, and he will pray for you and you will live. But if you do not restore her, know that you shall surely die, you and all who are yours.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abimelech arose early in the morning and called all his servants and told all these things in their hearing; and the men were greatly frightened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abimelech called Abraham and said to him, “What have you done to us? And how have I sinned against you, that you have brought on me and on my kingdom a great sin? You have done to me things that ought not to be done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abimelech said to Abraham, “What have you encountered, that you have done this thing?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham said, “Because I thought, surely there is no fear of God in this place, and they will kill me because of my wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Besides, she actually is my sister, the daughter of my father, but not the daughter of my mother, and she became my wife;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it came about, when God caused me to wander from my father’s house, that I said to her, ‘This is the kindness which you will show to me: everywhere we go, say of me, “He is my brother.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abimelech then took sheep and oxen and male and female servants, and gave them to Abraham, and restored his wife Sarah to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abimelech said, “Behold, my land is before you; settle wherever you please.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Sarah he said, “Behold, I have given your brother a thousand pieces of silver; behold, it is your vindication before all who are with you, and before all men you are cleared.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham prayed to God, and God healed Abimelech and his wife and his maids, so that they bore children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord had closed fast all the wombs of the household of Abimelech because of Sarah, Abraham’s wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord took note of Sarah as He had said, and the Lord did for Sarah as He had promised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Sarah conceived and bore a son to Abraham in his old age, at the appointed time of which God had spoken to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham called the name of his son who was born to him, whom Sarah bore to him, Isaac.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abraham circumcised his son Isaac when he was eight days old, as God had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Abraham was one hundred years old when his son Isaac was born to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sarah said, “God has made laughter for me; everyone who hears will laugh with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she said, “Who would have said to Abraham that Sarah would nurse children? Yet I have borne him a son in his old age.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The child grew and was weaned, and Abraham made a great feast on the day that Isaac was weaned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Sarah saw the son of Hagar the Egyptian, whom she had borne to Abraham, mocking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore she said to Abraham, “Drive out this maid and her son, for the son of this maid shall not be an heir with my son Isaac.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The matter distressed Abraham greatly because of his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God said to Abraham, “Do not be distressed because of the lad and your maid; whatever Sarah tells you, listen to her, for through Isaac your descendants shall be named.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the son of the maid I will make a nation also, because he is your descendant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abraham rose early in the morning and took bread and a skin of water and gave them to Hagar, putting them on her shoulder, and gave her the boy, and sent her away. And she departed and wandered about in the wilderness of Beersheba.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the water in the skin was used up, she left the boy under one of the bushes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she went and sat down opposite him, about a bowshot away, for she said, “Do not let me see the boy die.” And she sat opposite him, and lifted up her voice and wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God heard the lad crying; and the angel of God called to Hagar from heaven and said to her, “What is the matter with you, Hagar? Do not fear, for God has heard the voice of the lad where he is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Arise, lift up the lad, and hold him by the hand, for I will make a great nation of him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God opened her eyes and she saw a well of water; and she went and filled the skin with water and gave the lad a drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God was with the lad, and he grew; and he lived in the wilderness and became an archer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He lived in the wilderness of Paran, and his mother took a wife for him from the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came about at that time that Abimelech and Phicol, the commander of his army, spoke to Abraham, saying, “God is with you in all that you do;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: now therefore, swear to me here by God that you will not deal falsely with me or with my offspring or with my posterity, but according to the kindness that I have shown to you, you shall show to me and to the land in which you have sojourned.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham said, “I swear it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Abraham complained to Abimelech because of the well of water which the servants of Abimelech had seized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abimelech said, “I do not know who has done this thing; you did not tell me, nor did I hear of it until today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham took sheep and oxen and gave them to Abimelech, and the two of them made a covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abraham set seven ewe lambs of the flock by themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abimelech said to Abraham, “What do these seven ewe lambs mean, which you have set by themselves?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “You shall take these seven ewe lambs from my hand so that it may be a witness to me, that I dug this well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore he called that place Beersheba, because there the two of them took an oath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they made a covenant at Beersheba; and Abimelech and Phicol, the commander of his army, arose and returned to the land of the Philistines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham planted a tamarisk tree at Beersheba, and there he called on the name of the Lord, the Everlasting God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham sojourned in the land of the Philistines for many days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came about after these things, that God tested Abraham, and said to him, “Abraham!” And he said, “Here I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Take now your son, your only son, whom you love, Isaac, and go to the land of Moriah, and offer him there as a burnt offering on one of the mountains of which I will tell you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abraham rose early in the morning and saddled his donkey, and took two of his young men with him and Isaac his son; and he split wood for the burnt offering, and arose and went to the place of which God had told him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the third day Abraham raised his eyes and saw the place from a distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham said to his young men, “Stay here with the donkey, and I and the lad will go over there; and we will worship and return to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham took the wood of the burnt offering and laid it on Isaac his son, and he took in his hand the fire and the knife. So the two of them walked on together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isaac spoke to Abraham his father and said, “My father!” And he said, “Here I am, my son.” And he said, “Behold, the fire and the wood, but where is the lamb for the burnt offering?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham said, “God will provide for Himself the lamb for the burnt offering, my son.” So the two of them walked on together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they came to the place of which God had told him; and Abraham built the altar there and arranged the wood, and bound his son Isaac and laid him on the altar, on top of the wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham stretched out his hand and took the knife to slay his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the angel of the Lord called to him from heaven and said, “Abraham, Abraham!” And he said, “Here I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Do not stretch out your hand against the lad, and do nothing to him; for now I know that you fear God, since you have not withheld your son, your only son, from Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abraham raised his eyes and looked, and behold, behind him a ram caught in the thicket by his horns; and Abraham went and took the ram and offered him up for a burnt offering in the place of his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham called the name of that place The Lord Will Provide, as it is said to this day, “In the mount of the Lord it will be provided.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel of the Lord called to Abraham a second time from heaven,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “By Myself I have sworn, declares the Lord, because you have done this thing and have not withheld your son, your only son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: indeed I will greatly bless you, and I will greatly multiply your seed as the stars of the heavens and as the sand which is on the seashore; and your seed shall possess the gate of their enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In your seed all the nations of the earth shall be blessed, because you have obeyed My voice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abraham returned to his young men, and they arose and went together to Beersheba; and Abraham lived at Beersheba.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came about after these things, that it was told Abraham, saying, “Behold, Milcah also has borne children to your brother Nahor:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Uz his firstborn and Buz his brother and Kemuel the father of Aram
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Chesed and Hazo and Pildash and Jidlaph and Bethuel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bethuel became the father of Rebekah; these eight Milcah bore to Nahor, Abraham’s brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His concubine, whose name was Reumah, also bore Tebah and Gaham and Tahash and Maacah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Sarah lived one hundred and twenty-seven years; these were the years of the life of Sarah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sarah died in Kiriath-arba (that is, Hebron) in the land of Canaan; and Abraham went in to mourn for Sarah and to weep for her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abraham rose from before his dead, and spoke to the sons of Heth, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am a stranger and a sojourner among you; give me a burial site among you that I may bury my dead out of my sight.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Heth answered Abraham, saying to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hear us, my lord, you are a mighty prince among us; bury your dead in the choicest of our graves; none of us will refuse you his grave for burying your dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abraham rose and bowed to the people of the land, the sons of Heth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spoke with them, saying, “If it is your wish for me to bury my dead out of my sight, hear me, and approach Ephron the son of Zohar for me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that he may give me the cave of Machpelah which he owns, which is at the end of his field; for the full price let him give it to me in your presence for a burial site.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Ephron was sitting among the sons of Heth; and Ephron the Hittite answered Abraham in the hearing of the sons of Heth; even of all who went in at the gate of his city, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No, my lord, hear me; I give you the field, and I give you the cave that is in it. In the presence of the sons of my people I give it to you; bury your dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham bowed before the people of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke to Ephron in the hearing of the people of the land, saying, “If you will only please listen to me; I will give the price of the field, accept it from me that I may bury my dead there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Ephron answered Abraham, saying to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “My lord, listen to me; a piece of land worth four hundred shekels of silver, what is that between me and you? So bury your dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham listened to Ephron; and Abraham weighed out for Ephron the silver which he had named in the hearing of the sons of Heth, four hundred shekels of silver, commercial standard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Ephron’s field, which was in Machpelah, which faced Mamre, the field and cave which was in it, and all the trees which were in the field, that were within all the confines of its border, were deeded over
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to Abraham for a possession in the presence of the sons of Heth, before all who went in at the gate of his city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Abraham buried Sarah his wife in the cave of the field at Machpelah facing Mamre (that is, Hebron) in the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the field and the cave that is in it, were deeded over to Abraham for a burial site by the sons of Heth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Abraham was old, advanced in age; and the Lord had blessed Abraham in every way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham said to his servant, the oldest of his household, who had charge of all that he owned, “Please place your hand under my thigh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I will make you swear by the Lord, the God of heaven and the God of earth, that you shall not take a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites, among whom I live,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but you will go to my country and to my relatives, and take a wife for my son Isaac.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servant said to him, “Suppose the woman is not willing to follow me to this land; should I take your son back to the land from where you came?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abraham said to him, “Beware that you do not take my son back there!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord, the God of heaven, who took me from my father’s house and from the land of my birth, and who spoke to me and who swore to me, saying, ‘To your descendants I will give this land,’ He will send His angel before you, and you will take a wife for my son from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the woman is not willing to follow you, then you will be free from this my oath; only do not take my son back there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the servant placed his hand under the thigh of Abraham his master, and swore to him concerning this matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the servant took ten camels from the camels of his master, and set out with a variety of good things of his master’s in his hand; and he arose and went to Mesopotamia, to the city of Nahor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the camels kneel down outside the city by the well of water at evening time, the time when women go out to draw water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “O Lord, the God of my master Abraham, please grant me success today, and show lovingkindness to my master Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I am standing by the spring, and the daughters of the men of the city are coming out to draw water;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: now may it be that the girl to whom I say, ‘Please let down your jar so that I may drink,’ and who answers, ‘Drink, and I will water your camels also’—may she be the one whom You have appointed for Your servant Isaac; and by this I will know that You have shown lovingkindness to my master.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before he had finished speaking, behold, Rebekah who was born to Bethuel the son of Milcah, the wife of Abraham’s brother Nahor, came out with her jar on her shoulder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The girl was very beautiful, a virgin, and no man had had relations with her; and she went down to the spring and filled her jar and came up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the servant ran to meet her, and said, “Please let me drink a little water from your jar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said, “Drink, my lord”; and she quickly lowered her jar to her hand, and gave him a drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when she had finished giving him a drink, she said, “I will draw also for your camels until they have finished drinking.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she quickly emptied her jar into the trough, and ran back to the well to draw, and she drew for all his camels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, the man was gazing at her in silence, to know whether the Lord had made his journey successful or not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the camels had finished drinking, the man took a gold ring weighing a half-shekel and two bracelets for her wrists weighing ten shekels in gold,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “Whose daughter are you? Please tell me, is there room for us to lodge in your father’s house?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said to him, “I am the daughter of Bethuel, the son of Milcah, whom she bore to Nahor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again she said to him, “We have plenty of both straw and feed, and room to lodge in.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the man bowed low and worshiped the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Blessed be the Lord, the God of my master Abraham, who has not forsaken His lovingkindness and His truth toward my master; as for me, the Lord has guided me in the way to the house of my master’s brothers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the girl ran and told her mother’s household about these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Rebekah had a brother whose name was Laban; and Laban ran outside to the man at the spring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw the ring and the bracelets on his sister’s wrists, and when he heard the words of Rebekah his sister, saying, “This is what the man said to me,” he went to the man; and behold, he was standing by the camels at the spring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Come in, blessed of the Lord! Why do you stand outside since I have prepared the house, and a place for the camels?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the man entered the house. Then Laban unloaded the camels, and he gave straw and feed to the camels, and water to wash his feet and the feet of the men who were with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when food was set before him to eat, he said, “I will not eat until I have told my business.” And he said, “Speak on.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said, “I am Abraham’s servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord has greatly blessed my master, so that he has become rich; and He has given him flocks and herds, and silver and gold, and servants and maids, and camels and donkeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Sarah my master’s wife bore a son to my master in her old age, and he has given him all that he has.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My master made me swear, saying, ‘You shall not take a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites, in whose land I live;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but you shall go to my father’s house and to my relatives, and take a wife for my son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I said to my master, ‘Suppose the woman does not follow me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to me, ‘The Lord, before whom I have walked, will send His angel with you to make your journey successful, and you will take a wife for my son from my relatives and from my father’s house;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you will be free from my oath, when you come to my relatives; and if they do not give her to you, you will be free from my oath.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So I came today to the spring, and said, ‘O Lord, the God of my master Abraham, if now You will make my journey on which I go successful;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: behold, I am standing by the spring, and may it be that the maiden who comes out to draw, and to whom I say, “Please let me drink a little water from your jar”;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and she will say to me, “You drink, and I will draw for your camels also”; let her be the woman whom the Lord has appointed for my master’s son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Before I had finished speaking in my heart, behold, Rebekah came out with her jar on her shoulder, and went down to the spring and drew, and I said to her, ‘Please let me drink.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She quickly lowered her jar from her shoulder, and said, ‘Drink, and I will water your camels also’; so I drank, and she watered the camels also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I asked her, and said, ‘Whose daughter are you?’ And she said, ‘The daughter of Bethuel, Nahor’s son, whom Milcah bore to him’; and I put the ring on her nose, and the bracelets on her wrists.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I bowed low and worshiped the Lord, and blessed the Lord, the God of my master Abraham, who had guided me in the right way to take the daughter of my master’s kinsman for his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now if you are going to deal kindly and truly with my master, tell me; and if not, let me know, that I may turn to the right hand or the left.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Laban and Bethuel replied, “The matter comes from the Lord; so we cannot speak to you bad or good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Here is Rebekah before you, take her and go, and let her be the wife of your master’s son, as the Lord has spoken.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Abraham’s servant heard their words, he bowed himself to the ground before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servant brought out articles of silver and articles of gold, and garments, and gave them to Rebekah; he also gave precious things to her brother and to her mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he and the men who were with him ate and drank and spent the night. When they arose in the morning, he said, “Send me away to my master.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But her brother and her mother said, “Let the girl stay with us a few days, say ten; afterward she may go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Do not delay me, since the Lord has prospered my way. Send me away that I may go to my master.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “We will call the girl and consult her wishes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they called Rebekah and said to her, “Will you go with this man?” And she said, “I will go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus they sent away their sister Rebekah and her nurse with Abraham’s servant and his men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They blessed Rebekah and said to her,
“May you, our sister,
Become thousands of ten thousands,
And may your descendants possess
The gate of those who hate them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Rebekah arose with her maids, and they mounted the camels and followed the man. So the servant took Rebekah and departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Isaac had come from going to Beer-lahai-roi; for he was living in the Negev.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isaac went out to meditate in the field toward evening; and he lifted up his eyes and looked, and behold, camels were coming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rebekah lifted up her eyes, and when she saw Isaac she dismounted from the camel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said to the servant, “Who is that man walking in the field to meet us?” And the servant said, “He is my master.” Then she took her veil and covered herself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servant told Isaac all the things that he had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Isaac brought her into his mother Sarah’s tent, and he took Rebekah, and she became his wife, and he loved her; thus Isaac was comforted after his mother’s death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Abraham took another wife, whose name was Keturah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She bore to him Zimran and Jokshan and Medan and Midian and Ishbak and Shuah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jokshan became the father of Sheba and Dedan. And the sons of Dedan were Asshurim and Letushim and Leummim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Midian were Ephah and Epher and Hanoch and Abida and Eldaah. All these were the sons of Keturah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Abraham gave all that he had to Isaac;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but to the sons of his concubines, Abraham gave gifts while he was still living, and sent them away from his son Isaac eastward, to the land of the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are all the years of Abraham’s life that he lived, one hundred and seventy-five years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham breathed his last and died in a ripe old age, an old man and satisfied with life; and he was gathered to his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his sons Isaac and Ishmael buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron the son of Zohar the Hittite, facing Mamre,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the field which Abraham purchased from the sons of Heth; there Abraham was buried with Sarah his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It came about after the death of Abraham, that God blessed his son Isaac; and Isaac lived by Beer-lahai-roi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the records of the generations of Ishmael, Abraham’s son, whom Hagar the Egyptian, Sarah’s maid, bore to Abraham;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and these are the names of the sons of Ishmael, by their names, in the order of their birth: Nebaioth, the firstborn of Ishmael, and Kedar and Adbeel and Mibsam
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Mishma and Dumah and Massa,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hadad and Tema, Jetur, Naphish and Kedemah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Ishmael and these are their names, by their villages, and by their camps; twelve princes according to their tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the years of the life of Ishmael, one hundred and thirty-seven years; and he breathed his last and died, and was gathered to his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They settled from Havilah to Shur which is east of Egypt as one goes toward Assyria; he settled in defiance of all his relatives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the records of the generations of Isaac, Abraham’s son: Abraham became the father of Isaac;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah, the daughter of Bethuel the Aramean of Paddan-aram, the sister of Laban the Aramean, to be his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isaac prayed to the Lord on behalf of his wife, because she was barren; and the Lord answered him and Rebekah his wife conceived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the children struggled together within her; and she said, “If it is so, why then am I this way?” So she went to inquire of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: When her days to be delivered were fulfilled, behold, there were twins in her womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the first came forth red, all over like a hairy garment; and they named him Esau.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward his brother came forth with his hand holding on to Esau’s heel, so his name was called Jacob; and Isaac was sixty years old when she gave birth to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the boys grew up, Esau became a skillful hunter, a man of the field, but Jacob was a peaceful man, living in tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Isaac loved Esau, because he had a taste for game, but Rebekah loved Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jacob had cooked stew, Esau came in from the field and he was famished;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Esau said to Jacob, “Please let me have a swallow of that red stuff there, for I am famished.” Therefore his name was called Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jacob said, “First sell me your birthright.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Esau said, “Behold, I am about to die; so of what use then is the birthright to me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob said, “First swear to me”; so he swore to him, and sold his birthright to Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob gave Esau bread and lentil stew; and he ate and drank, and rose and went on his way. Thus Esau despised his birthright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a famine in the land, besides the previous famine that had occurred in the days of Abraham. So Isaac went to Gerar, to Abimelech king of the Philistines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord appeared to him and said, “Do not go down to Egypt; stay in the land of which I shall tell you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sojourn in this land and I will be with you and bless you, for to you and to your descendants I will give all these lands, and I will establish the oath which I swore to your father Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will multiply your descendants as the stars of heaven, and will give your descendants all these lands; and by your descendants all the nations of the earth shall be blessed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because Abraham obeyed Me and kept My charge, My commandments, My statutes and My laws.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Isaac lived in Gerar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the men of the place asked about his wife, he said, “She is my sister,” for he was afraid to say, “my wife,” thinking, “the men of the place might kill me on account of Rebekah, for she is beautiful.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It came about, when he had been there a long time, that Abimelech king of the Philistines looked out through a window, and saw, and behold, Isaac was caressing his wife Rebekah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abimelech called Isaac and said, “Behold, certainly she is your wife! How then did you say, ‘She is my sister’?” And Isaac said to him, “Because I said, ‘I might die on account of her.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abimelech said, “What is this you have done to us? One of the people might easily have lain with your wife, and you would have brought guilt upon us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abimelech charged all the people, saying, “He who touches this man or his wife shall surely be put to death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Isaac sowed in that land and reaped in the same year a hundredfold. And the Lord blessed him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the man became rich, and continued to grow richer until he became very wealthy;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he had possessions of flocks and herds and a great household, so that the Philistines envied him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now all the wells which his father’s servants had dug in the days of Abraham his father, the Philistines stopped up by filling them with earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abimelech said to Isaac, “Go away from us, for you are too powerful for us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Isaac departed from there and camped in the valley of Gerar, and settled there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Isaac dug again the wells of water which had been dug in the days of his father Abraham, for the Philistines had stopped them up after the death of Abraham; and he gave them the same names which his father had given them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Isaac’s servants dug in the valley and found there a well of flowing water,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the herdsmen of Gerar quarreled with the herdsmen of Isaac, saying, “The water is ours!” So he named the well Esek, because they contended with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they dug another well, and they quarreled over it too, so he named it Sitnah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He moved away from there and dug another well, and they did not quarrel over it; so he named it Rehoboth, for he said, “At last the Lord has made room for us, and we will be fruitful in the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went up from there to Beersheba.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord appeared to him the same night and said,
“I am the God of your father Abraham;
Do not fear, for I am with you.
I will bless you, and multiply your descendants,
For the sake of My servant Abraham.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he built an altar there and called upon the name of the Lord, and pitched his tent there; and there Isaac’s servants dug a well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abimelech came to him from Gerar with his adviser Ahuzzath and Phicol the commander of his army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isaac said to them, “Why have you come to me, since you hate me and have sent me away from you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “We see plainly that the Lord has been with you; so we said, ‘Let there now be an oath between us, even between you and us, and let us make a covenant with you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you will do us no harm, just as we have not touched you and have done to you nothing but good and have sent you away in peace. You are now the blessed of the Lord.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he made them a feast, and they ate and drank.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning they arose early and exchanged oaths; then Isaac sent them away and they departed from him in peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came about on the same day, that Isaac’s servants came in and told him about the well which they had dug, and said to him, “We have found water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he called it Shibah; therefore the name of the city is Beersheba to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Esau was forty years old he married Judith the daughter of Beeri the Hittite, and Basemath the daughter of Elon the Hittite;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they brought grief to Isaac and Rebekah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came about, when Isaac was old and his eyes were too dim to see, that he called his older son Esau and said to him, “My son.” And he said to him, “Here I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isaac said, “Behold now, I am old and I do not know the day of my death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now then, please take your gear, your quiver and your bow, and go out to the field and hunt game for me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and prepare a savory dish for me such as I love, and bring it to me that I may eat, so that my soul may bless you before I die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rebekah was listening while Isaac spoke to his son Esau. So when Esau went to the field to hunt for game to bring home,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rebekah said to her son Jacob, “Behold, I heard your father speak to your brother Esau, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Bring me some game and prepare a savory dish for me, that I may eat, and bless you in the presence of the Lord before my death.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, my son, listen to me as I command you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go now to the flock and bring me two choice young goats from there, that I may prepare them as a savory dish for your father, such as he loves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall bring it to your father, that he may eat, so that he may bless you before his death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob answered his mother Rebekah, “Behold, Esau my brother is a hairy man and I am a smooth man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Perhaps my father will feel me, then I will be as a deceiver in his sight, and I will bring upon myself a curse and not a blessing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his mother said to him, “Your curse be on me, my son; only obey my voice, and go, get them for me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he went and got them, and brought them to his mother; and his mother made savory food such as his father loved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Rebekah took the best garments of Esau her elder son, which were with her in the house, and put them on Jacob her younger son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she put the skins of the young goats on his hands and on the smooth part of his neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She also gave the savory food and the bread, which she had made, to her son Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he came to his father and said, “My father.” And he said, “Here I am. Who are you, my son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob said to his father, “I am Esau your firstborn; I have done as you told me. Get up, please, sit and eat of my game, that you may bless me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isaac said to his son, “How is it that you have it so quickly, my son?” And he said, “Because the Lord your God caused it to happen to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Isaac said to Jacob, “Please come close, that I may feel you, my son, whether you are really my son Esau or not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jacob came close to Isaac his father, and he felt him and said, “The voice is the voice of Jacob, but the hands are the hands of Esau.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did not recognize him, because his hands were hairy like his brother Esau’s hands; so he blessed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Are you really my son Esau?” And he said, “I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said, “Bring it to me, and I will eat of my son’s game, that I may bless you.” And he brought it to him, and he ate; he also brought him wine and he drank.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his father Isaac said to him, “Please come close and kiss me, my son.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
May peoples serve you,
And nations bow down to you;
Be master of your brothers,
And may your mother’s sons bow down to you.
Cursed be those who curse you,
And blessed be those who bless you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came about, as soon as Isaac had finished blessing Jacob, and Jacob had hardly gone out from the presence of Isaac his father, that Esau his brother came in from his hunting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he also made savory food, and brought it to his father; and he said to his father, “Let my father arise and eat of his son’s game, that you may bless me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isaac his father said to him, “Who are you?” And he said, “I am your son, your firstborn, Esau.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Isaac trembled violently, and said, “Who was he then that hunted game and brought it to me, so that I ate of all of it before you came, and blessed him? Yes, and he shall be blessed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Esau heard the words of his father, he cried out with an exceedingly great and bitter cry, and said to his father, “Bless me, even me also, O my father!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Your brother came deceitfully and has taken away your blessing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Is he not rightly named Jacob, for he has supplanted me these two times? He took away my birthright, and behold, now he has taken away my blessing.” And he said, “Have you not reserved a blessing for me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Isaac replied to Esau, “Behold, I have made him your master, and all his relatives I have given to him as servants; and with grain and new wine I have sustained him. Now as for you then, what can I do, my son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Esau said to his father, “Do you have only one blessing, my father? Bless me, even me also, O my father.” So Esau lifted his voice and wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Isaac his father answered and said to him,
“Behold, away from the fertility of the earth shall be your dwelling,
And away from the dew of heaven from above.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“By your sword you shall live,
And your brother you shall serve;
But it shall come about when you become restless,
That you will break his yoke from your neck.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Esau bore a grudge against Jacob because of the blessing with which his father had blessed him; and Esau said to himself, “The days of mourning for my father are near; then I will kill my brother Jacob.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the words of her elder son Esau were reported to Rebekah, she sent and called her younger son Jacob, and said to him, “Behold your brother Esau is consoling himself concerning you by planning to kill you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, my son, obey my voice, and arise, flee to Haran, to my brother Laban!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stay with him a few days, until your brother’s fury subsides,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until your brother’s anger against you subsides and he forgets what you did to him. Then I will send and get you from there. Why should I be bereaved of you both in one day?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rebekah said to Isaac, “I am tired of living because of the daughters of Heth; if Jacob takes a wife from the daughters of Heth, like these, from the daughters of the land, what good will my life be to me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Isaac called Jacob and blessed him and charged him, and said to him, “You shall not take a wife from the daughters of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Arise, go to Paddan-aram, to the house of Bethuel your mother’s father; and from there take to yourself a wife from the daughters of Laban your mother’s brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May God Almighty bless you and make you fruitful and multiply you, that you may become a company of peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May He also give you the blessing of Abraham, to you and to your descendants with you, that you may possess the land of your sojournings, which God gave to Abraham.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Isaac sent Jacob away, and he went to Paddan-aram to Laban, son of Bethuel the Aramean, the brother of Rebekah, the mother of Jacob and Esau.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob and sent him away to Paddan-aram to take to himself a wife from there, and that when he blessed him he charged him, saying, “You shall not take a wife from the daughters of Canaan,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that Jacob had obeyed his father and his mother and had gone to Paddan-aram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Esau saw that the daughters of Canaan displeased his father Isaac;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Esau went to Ishmael, and married, besides the wives that he had, Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael, Abraham’s son, the sister of Nebaioth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob departed from Beersheba and went toward Haran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to a certain place and spent the night there, because the sun had set; and he took one of the stones of the place and put it under his head, and lay down in that place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had a dream, and behold, a ladder was set on the earth with its top reaching to heaven; and behold, the angels of God were ascending and descending on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, the Lord stood above it and said, “I am the Lord, the God of your father Abraham and the God of Isaac; the land on which you lie, I will give it to you and to your descendants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your descendants will also be like the dust of the earth, and you will spread out to the west and to the east and to the north and to the south; and in you and in your descendants shall all the families of the earth be blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I am with you and will keep you wherever you go, and will bring you back to this land; for I will not leave you until I have done what I have promised you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob awoke from his sleep and said, “Surely the Lord is in this place, and I did not know it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was afraid and said, “How awesome is this place! This is none other than the house of God, and this is the gate of heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jacob rose early in the morning, and took the stone that he had put under his head and set it up as a pillar and poured oil on its top.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called the name of that place Bethel; however, previously the name of the city had been Luz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob made a vow, saying, “If God will be with me and will keep me on this journey that I take, and will give me food to eat and garments to wear,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I return to my father’s house in safety, then the Lord will be my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This stone, which I have set up as a pillar, will be God’s house, and of all that You give me I will surely give a tenth to You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob went on his journey, and came to the land of the sons of the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He looked, and saw a well in the field, and behold, three flocks of sheep were lying there beside it, for from that well they watered the flocks. Now the stone on the mouth of the well was large.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the flocks were gathered there, they would then roll the stone from the mouth of the well and water the sheep, and put the stone back in its place on the mouth of the well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob said to them, “My brothers, where are you from?” And they said, “We are from Haran.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Do you know Laban the son of Nahor?” And they said, “We know him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Is it well with him?” And they said, “It is well, and here is Rachel his daughter coming with the sheep.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Behold, it is still high day; it is not time for the livestock to be gathered. Water the sheep, and go, pasture them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they said, “We cannot, until all the flocks are gathered, and they roll the stone from the mouth of the well; then we water the sheep.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking with them, Rachel came with her father’s sheep, for she was a shepherdess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jacob saw Rachel the daughter of Laban his mother’s brother, and the sheep of Laban his mother’s brother, Jacob went up and rolled the stone from the mouth of the well and watered the flock of Laban his mother’s brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob kissed Rachel, and lifted his voice and wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob told Rachel that he was a relative of her father and that he was Rebekah’s son, and she ran and told her father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Laban heard the news of Jacob his sister’s son, he ran to meet him, and embraced him and kissed him and brought him to his house. Then he related to Laban all these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Laban said to him, “Surely you are my bone and my flesh.” And he stayed with him a month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Laban said to Jacob, “Because you are my relative, should you therefore serve me for nothing? Tell me, what shall your wages be?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Laban had two daughters; the name of the older was Leah, and the name of the younger was Rachel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Leah’s eyes were weak, but Rachel was beautiful of form and face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jacob loved Rachel, so he said, “I will serve you seven years for your younger daughter Rachel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Laban said, “It is better that I give her to you than to give her to another man; stay with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jacob served seven years for Rachel and they seemed to him but a few days because of his love for her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob said to Laban, “Give me my wife, for my time is completed, that I may go in to her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Laban gathered all the men of the place and made a feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the evening he took his daughter Leah, and brought her to him; and Jacob went in to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Laban also gave his maid Zilpah to his daughter Leah as a maid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it came about in the morning that, behold, it was Leah! And he said to Laban, “What is this you have done to me? Was it not for Rachel that I served with you? Why then have you deceived me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Laban said, “It is not the practice in our place to marry off the younger before the firstborn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Complete the week of this one, and we will give you the other also for the service which you shall serve with me for another seven years.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob did so and completed her week, and he gave him his daughter Rachel as his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Laban also gave his maid Bilhah to his daughter Rachel as her maid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jacob went in to Rachel also, and indeed he loved Rachel more than Leah, and he served with Laban for another seven years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord saw that Leah was unloved, and He opened her womb, but Rachel was barren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Leah conceived and bore a son and named him Reuben, for she said, “Because the Lord has seen my affliction; surely now my husband will love me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she conceived again and bore a son and said, “Because the Lord has heard that I am unloved, He has therefore given me this son also.” So she named him Simeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She conceived again and bore a son and said, “Now this time my husband will become attached to me, because I have borne him three sons.” Therefore he was named Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she conceived again and bore a son and said, “This time I will praise the Lord.” Therefore she named him Judah. Then she stopped bearing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Rachel saw that she bore Jacob no children, she became jealous of her sister; and she said to Jacob, “Give me children, or else I die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob’s anger burned against Rachel, and he said, “Am I in the place of God, who has withheld from you the fruit of the womb?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said, “Here is my maid Bilhah, go in to her that she may bear on my knees, that through her I too may have children.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she gave him her maid Bilhah as a wife, and Jacob went in to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bilhah conceived and bore Jacob a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Rachel said, “God has vindicated me, and has indeed heard my voice and has given me a son.” Therefore she named him Dan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rachel’s maid Bilhah conceived again and bore Jacob a second son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Rachel said, “With mighty wrestlings I have wrestled with my sister, and I have indeed prevailed.” And she named him Naphtali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Leah saw that she had stopped bearing, she took her maid Zilpah and gave her to Jacob as a wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Leah’s maid Zilpah bore Jacob a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Leah said, “How fortunate!” So she named him Gad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Leah’s maid Zilpah bore Jacob a second son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Leah said, “Happy am I! For women will call me happy.” So she named him Asher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the days of wheat harvest Reuben went and found mandrakes in the field, and brought them to his mother Leah. Then Rachel said to Leah, “Please give me some of your son’s mandrakes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But she said to her, “Is it a small matter for you to take my husband? And would you take my son’s mandrakes also?” So Rachel said, “Therefore he may lie with you tonight in return for your son’s mandrakes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jacob came in from the field in the evening, then Leah went out to meet him and said, “You must come in to me, for I have surely hired you with my son’s mandrakes.” So he lay with her that night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God gave heed to Leah, and she conceived and bore Jacob a fifth son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Leah said, “God has given me my wages because I gave my maid to my husband.” So she named him Issachar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Leah conceived again and bore a sixth son to Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Leah said, “God has endowed me with a good gift; now my husband will dwell with me, because I have borne him six sons.” So she named him Zebulun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward she bore a daughter and named her Dinah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God remembered Rachel, and God gave heed to her and opened her womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she conceived and bore a son and said, “God has taken away my reproach.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She named him Joseph, saying, “May the Lord give me another son.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came about when Rachel had borne Joseph, that Jacob said to Laban, “Send me away, that I may go to my own place and to my own country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give me my wives and my children for whom I have served you, and let me depart; for you yourself know my service which I have rendered you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Laban said to him, “If now it pleases you, stay with me; I have divined that the Lord has blessed me on your account.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He continued, “Name me your wages, and I will give it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to him, “You yourself know how I have served you and how your cattle have fared with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you had little before I came and it has increased to a multitude, and the Lord has blessed you wherever I turned. But now, when shall I provide for my own household also?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said, “What shall I give you?” And Jacob said, “You shall not give me anything. If you will do this one thing for me, I will again pasture and keep your flock:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: let me pass through your entire flock today, removing from there every speckled and spotted sheep and every black one among the lambs and the spotted and speckled among the goats; and such shall be my wages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So my honesty will answer for me later, when you come concerning my wages. Every one that is not speckled and spotted among the goats and black among the lambs, if found with me, will be considered stolen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Laban said, “Good, let it be according to your word.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he removed on that day the striped and spotted male goats and all the speckled and spotted female goats, every one with white in it, and all the black ones among the sheep, and gave them into the care of his sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he put a distance of three days’ journey between himself and Jacob, and Jacob fed the rest of Laban’s flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob took fresh rods of poplar and almond and plane trees, and peeled white stripes in them, exposing the white which was in the rods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He set the rods which he had peeled in front of the flocks in the gutters, even in the watering troughs, where the flocks came to drink; and they mated when they came to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the flocks mated by the rods, and the flocks brought forth striped, speckled, and spotted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob separated the lambs, and made the flocks face toward the striped and all the black in the flock of Laban; and he put his own herds apart, and did not put them with Laban’s flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, whenever the stronger of the flock were mating, Jacob would place the rods in the sight of the flock in the gutters, so that they might mate by the rods;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when the flock was feeble, he did not put them in; so the feebler were Laban’s and the stronger Jacob’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the man became exceedingly prosperous, and had large flocks and female and male servants and camels and donkeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jacob heard the words of Laban’s sons, saying, “Jacob has taken away all that was our father’s, and from what belonged to our father he has made all this wealth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob saw the attitude of Laban, and behold, it was not friendly toward him as formerly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Jacob, “Return to the land of your fathers and to your relatives, and I will be with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jacob sent and called Rachel and Leah to his flock in the field,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, “I see your father’s attitude, that it is not friendly toward me as formerly, but the God of my father has been with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know that I have served your father with all my strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet your father has cheated me and changed my wages ten times; however, God did not allow him to hurt me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he spoke thus, ‘The speckled shall be your wages,’ then all the flock brought forth speckled; and if he spoke thus, ‘The striped shall be your wages,’ then all the flock brought forth striped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus God has taken away your father’s livestock and given them to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came about at the time when the flock were mating that I lifted up my eyes and saw in a dream, and behold, the male goats which were mating were striped, speckled, and mottled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel of God said to me in the dream, ‘Jacob,’ and I said, ‘Here I am.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, ‘Lift up now your eyes and see that all the male goats which are mating are striped, speckled, and mottled; for I have seen all that Laban has been doing to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the God of Bethel, where you anointed a pillar, where you made a vow to Me; now arise, leave this land, and return to the land of your birth.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rachel and Leah said to him, “Do we still have any portion or inheritance in our father’s house?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are we not reckoned by him as foreigners? For he has sold us, and has also entirely consumed our purchase price.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely all the wealth which God has taken away from our father belongs to us and our children; now then, do whatever God has said to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob arose and put his children and his wives upon camels;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he drove away all his livestock and all his property which he had gathered, his acquired livestock which he had gathered in Paddan-aram, to go to the land of Canaan to his father Isaac.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Laban had gone to shear his flock, then Rachel stole the household idols that were her father’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob deceived Laban the Aramean by not telling him that he was fleeing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he fled with all that he had; and he arose and crossed the Euphrates River, and set his face toward the hill country of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was told Laban on the third day that Jacob had fled,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he took his kinsmen with him and pursued him a distance of seven days’ journey, and he overtook him in the hill country of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God came to Laban the Aramean in a dream of the night and said to him, “Be careful that you do not speak to Jacob either good or bad.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Laban caught up with Jacob. Now Jacob had pitched his tent in the hill country, and Laban with his kinsmen camped in the hill country of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Laban said to Jacob, “What have you done by deceiving me and carrying away my daughters like captives of the sword?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why did you flee secretly and deceive me, and did not tell me so that I might have sent you away with joy and with songs, with timbrel and with lyre;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and did not allow me to kiss my sons and my daughters? Now you have done foolishly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is in my power to do you harm, but the God of your father spoke to me last night, saying, ‘Be careful not to speak either good or bad to Jacob.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now you have indeed gone away because you longed greatly for your father’s house; but why did you steal my gods?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob replied to Laban, “Because I was afraid, for I thought that you would take your daughters from me by force.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one with whom you find your gods shall not live; in the presence of our kinsmen point out what is yours among my belongings and take it for yourself.” For Jacob did not know that Rachel had stolen them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Laban went into Jacob’s tent and into Leah’s tent and into the tent of the two maids, but he did not find them. Then he went out of Leah’s tent and entered Rachel’s tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Rachel had taken the household idols and put them in the camel’s saddle, and she sat on them. And Laban felt through all the tent but did not find them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said to her father, “Let not my lord be angry that I cannot rise before you, for the manner of women is upon me.” So he searched but did not find the household idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob became angry and contended with Laban; and Jacob said to Laban, “What is my transgression? What is my sin that you have hotly pursued me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though you have felt through all my goods, what have you found of all your household goods? Set it here before my kinsmen and your kinsmen, that they may decide between us two.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These twenty years I have been with you; your ewes and your female goats have not miscarried, nor have I eaten the rams of your flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That which was torn of beasts I did not bring to you; I bore the loss of it myself. You required it of my hand whether stolen by day or stolen by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus I was: by day the heat consumed me and the frost by night, and my sleep fled from my eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These twenty years I have been in your house; I served you fourteen years for your two daughters and six years for your flock, and you changed my wages ten times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the God of my father, the God of Abraham, and the fear of Isaac, had not been for me, surely now you would have sent me away empty-handed. God has seen my affliction and the toil of my hands, so He rendered judgment last night.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Laban replied to Jacob, “The daughters are my daughters, and the children are my children, and the flocks are my flocks, and all that you see is mine. But what can I do this day to these my daughters or to their children whom they have borne?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now come, let us make a covenant, you and I, and let it be a witness between you and me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob took a stone and set it up as a pillar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob said to his kinsmen, “Gather stones.” So they took stones and made a heap, and they ate there by the heap.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Laban called it Jegar-sahadutha, but Jacob called it Galeed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Laban said, “This heap is a witness between you and me this day.” Therefore it was named Galeed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Mizpah, for he said, “May the Lord watch between you and me when we are absent one from the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you mistreat my daughters, or if you take wives besides my daughters, although no man is with us, see, God is witness between you and me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Laban said to Jacob, “Behold this heap and behold the pillar which I have set between you and me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This heap is a witness, and the pillar is a witness, that I will not pass by this heap to you for harm, and you will not pass by this heap and this pillar to me, for harm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God of Abraham and the God of Nahor, the God of their father, judge between us.” So Jacob swore by the fear of his father Isaac.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob offered a sacrifice on the mountain, and called his kinsmen to the meal; and they ate the meal and spent the night on the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Early in the morning Laban arose, and kissed his sons and his daughters and blessed them. Then Laban departed and returned to his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as Jacob went on his way, the angels of God met him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob said when he saw them, “This is God’s camp.” So he named that place Mahanaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob sent messengers before him to his brother Esau in the land of Seir, the country of Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also commanded them saying, “Thus you shall say to my lord Esau: ‘Thus says your servant Jacob, “I have sojourned with Laban, and stayed until now;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have oxen and donkeys and flocks and male and female servants; and I have sent to tell my lord, that I may find favor in your sight.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The messengers returned to Jacob, saying, “We came to your brother Esau, and furthermore he is coming to meet you, and four hundred men are with him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob was greatly afraid and distressed; and he divided the people who were with him, and the flocks and the herds and the camels, into two companies;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he said, “If Esau comes to the one company and attacks it, then the company which is left will escape.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob said, “O God of my father Abraham and God of my father Isaac, O Lord, who said to me, ‘Return to your country and to your relatives, and I will prosper you,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am unworthy of all the lovingkindness and of all the faithfulness which You have shown to Your servant; for with my staff only I crossed this Jordan, and now I have become two companies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Deliver me, I pray, from the hand of my brother, from the hand of Esau; for I fear him, that he will come and attack me and the mothers with the children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For You said, ‘I will surely prosper you and make your descendants as the sand of the sea, which is too great to be numbered.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he spent the night there. Then he selected from what he had with him a present for his brother Esau:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: two hundred female goats and twenty male goats, two hundred ewes and twenty rams,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thirty milking camels and their colts, forty cows and ten bulls, twenty female donkeys and ten male donkeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He delivered them into the hand of his servants, every drove by itself, and said to his servants, “Pass on before me, and put a space between droves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He commanded the one in front, saying, “When my brother Esau meets you and asks you, saying, ‘To whom do you belong, and where are you going, and to whom do these animals in front of you belong?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall say, ‘These belong to your servant Jacob; it is a present sent to my lord Esau. And behold, he also is behind us.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he commanded also the second and the third, and all those who followed the droves, saying, “After this manner you shall speak to Esau when you find him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you shall say, ‘Behold, your servant Jacob also is behind us.’” For he said, “I will appease him with the present that goes before me. Then afterward I will see his face; perhaps he will accept me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the present passed on before him, while he himself spent that night in the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he arose that same night and took his two wives and his two maids and his eleven children, and crossed the ford of the Jabbok.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took them and sent them across the stream. And he sent across whatever he had.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob was left alone, and a man wrestled with him until daybreak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw that he had not prevailed against him, he touched the socket of his thigh; so the socket of Jacob’s thigh was dislocated while he wrestled with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Let me go, for the dawn is breaking.” But he said, “I will not let you go unless you bless me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to him, “What is your name?” And he said, “Jacob.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Your name shall no longer be Jacob, but Israel; for you have striven with God and with men and have prevailed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob asked him and said, “Please tell me your name.” But he said, “Why is it that you ask my name?” And he blessed him there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jacob named the place Peniel, for he said, “I have seen God face to face, yet my life has been preserved.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the sun rose upon him just as he crossed over Penuel, and he was limping on his thigh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, to this day the sons of Israel do not eat the sinew of the hip which is on the socket of the thigh, because he touched the socket of Jacob’s thigh in the sinew of the hip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob lifted his eyes and looked, and behold, Esau was coming, and four hundred men with him. So he divided the children among Leah and Rachel and the two maids.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put the maids and their children in front, and Leah and her children next, and Rachel and Joseph last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he himself passed on ahead of them and bowed down to the ground seven times, until he came near to his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Esau ran to meet him and embraced him, and fell on his neck and kissed him, and they wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He lifted his eyes and saw the women and the children, and said, “Who are these with you?” So he said, “The children whom God has graciously given your servant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the maids came near with their children, and they bowed down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Leah likewise came near with her children, and they bowed down; and afterward Joseph came near with Rachel, and they bowed down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “What do you mean by all this company which I have met?” And he said, “To find favor in the sight of my lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Esau said, “I have plenty, my brother; let what you have be your own.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob said, “No, please, if now I have found favor in your sight, then take my present from my hand, for I see your face as one sees the face of God, and you have received me favorably.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Please take my gift which has been brought to you, because God has dealt graciously with me and because I have plenty.” Thus he urged him and he took it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Esau said, “Let us take our journey and go, and I will go before you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to him, “My lord knows that the children are frail and that the flocks and herds which are nursing are a care to me. And if they are driven hard one day, all the flocks will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Please let my lord pass on before his servant, and I will proceed at my leisure, according to the pace of the cattle that are before me and according to the pace of the children, until I come to my lord at Seir.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Esau said, “Please let me leave with you some of the people who are with me.” But he said, “What need is there? Let me find favor in the sight of my lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Esau returned that day on his way to Seir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob journeyed to Succoth, and built for himself a house and made booths for his livestock; therefore the place is named Succoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jacob came safely to the city of Shechem, which is in the land of Canaan, when he came from Paddan-aram, and camped before the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He bought the piece of land where he had pitched his tent from the hand of the sons of Hamor, Shechem’s father, for one hundred pieces of money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he erected there an altar and called it El-Elohe-Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Dinah the daughter of Leah, whom she had borne to Jacob, went out to visit the daughters of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Shechem the son of Hamor the Hivite, the prince of the land, saw her, he took her and lay with her by force.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was deeply attracted to Dinah the daughter of Jacob, and he loved the girl and spoke tenderly to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Shechem spoke to his father Hamor, saying, “Get me this young girl for a wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jacob heard that he had defiled Dinah his daughter; but his sons were with his livestock in the field, so Jacob kept silent until they came in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Hamor the father of Shechem went out to Jacob to speak with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the sons of Jacob came in from the field when they heard it; and the men were grieved, and they were very angry because he had done a disgraceful thing in Israel by lying with Jacob’s daughter, for such a thing ought not to be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Hamor spoke with them, saying, “The soul of my son Shechem longs for your daughter; please give her to him in marriage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Intermarry with us; give your daughters to us and take our daughters for yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator
