verses.text: Thus you shall live with us, and the land shall be open before you; live and trade in it and acquire property in it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shechem also said to her father and to her brothers, “If I find favor in your sight, then I will give whatever you say to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ask me ever so much bridal payment and gift, and I will give according as you say to me; but give me the girl in marriage.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jacob’s sons answered Shechem and his father Hamor with deceit, because he had defiled Dinah their sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to them, “We cannot do this thing, to give our sister to one who is uncircumcised, for that would be a disgrace to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only on this condition will we consent to you: if you will become like us, in that every male of you be circumcised,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then we will give our daughters to you, and we will take your daughters for ourselves, and we will live with you and become one people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you will not listen to us to be circumcised, then we will take our daughter and go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now their words seemed reasonable to Hamor and Shechem, Hamor’s son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The young man did not delay to do the thing, because he was delighted with Jacob’s daughter. Now he was more respected than all the household of his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Hamor and his son Shechem came to the gate of their city and spoke to the men of their city, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These men are friendly with us; therefore let them live in the land and trade in it, for behold, the land is large enough for them. Let us take their daughters in marriage, and give our daughters to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only on this condition will the men consent to us to live with us, to become one people: that every male among us be circumcised as they are circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will not their livestock and their property and all their animals be ours? Only let us consent to them, and they will live with us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who went out of the gate of his city listened to Hamor and to his son Shechem, and every male was circumcised, all who went out of the gate of his city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came about on the third day, when they were in pain, that two of Jacob’s sons, Simeon and Levi, Dinah’s brothers, each took his sword and came upon the city unawares, and killed every male.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They killed Hamor and his son Shechem with the edge of the sword, and took Dinah from Shechem’s house, and went forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob’s sons came upon the slain and looted the city, because they had defiled their sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took their flocks and their herds and their donkeys, and that which was in the city and that which was in the field;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they captured and looted all their wealth and all their little ones and their wives, even all that was in the houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob said to Simeon and Levi, “You have brought trouble on me by making me odious among the inhabitants of the land, among the Canaanites and the Perizzites; and my men being few in number, they will gather together against me and attack me and I will be destroyed, I and my household.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they said, “Should he treat our sister as a harlot?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God said to Jacob, “Arise, go up to Bethel and live there, and make an altar there to God, who appeared to you when you fled from your brother Esau.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jacob said to his household and to all who were with him, “Put away the foreign gods which are among you, and purify yourselves and change your garments;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and let us arise and go up to Bethel, and I will make an altar there to God, who answered me in the day of my distress and has been with me wherever I have gone.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they gave to Jacob all the foreign gods which they had and the rings which were in their ears, and Jacob hid them under the oak which was near Shechem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they journeyed, there was a great terror upon the cities which were around them, and they did not pursue the sons of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jacob came to Luz (that is, Bethel), which is in the land of Canaan, he and all the people who were with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He built an altar there, and called the place El-bethel, because there God had revealed Himself to him when he fled from his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Deborah, Rebekah’s nurse, died, and she was buried below Bethel under the oak; it was named Allon-bacuth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God appeared to Jacob again when he came from Paddan-aram, and He blessed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God said to him,
“Your name is Jacob;
You shall no longer be called Jacob,
But Israel shall be your name.”
Thus He called him Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“The land which I gave to Abraham and Isaac,
I will give it to you,
And I will give the land to your descendants after you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God went up from him in the place where He had spoken with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob set up a pillar in the place where He had spoken with him, a pillar of stone, and he poured out a drink offering on it; he also poured oil on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jacob named the place where God had spoken with him, Bethel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they journeyed from Bethel; and when there was still some distance to go to Ephrath, Rachel began to give birth and she suffered severe labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she was in severe labor the midwife said to her, “Do not fear, for now you have another son.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It came about as her soul was departing (for she died), that she named him Ben-oni; but his father called him Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Rachel died and was buried on the way to Ephrath (that is, Bethlehem).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob set up a pillar over her grave; that is the pillar of Rachel’s grave to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Israel journeyed on and pitched his tent beyond the tower of Eder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It came about while Israel was dwelling in that land, that Reuben went and lay with Bilhah his father’s concubine, and Israel heard of it.
Now there were twelve sons of Jacob—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the sons of Leah: Reuben, Jacob’s firstborn, then Simeon and Levi and Judah and Issachar and Zebulun;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the sons of Rachel: Joseph and Benjamin;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sons of Bilhah, Rachel’s maid: Dan and Naphtali;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sons of Zilpah, Leah’s maid: Gad and Asher. These are the sons of Jacob who were born to him in Paddan-aram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob came to his father Isaac at Mamre of Kiriath-arba (that is, Hebron), where Abraham and Isaac had sojourned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the days of Isaac were one hundred and eighty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isaac breathed his last and died and was gathered to his people, an old man of ripe age; and his sons Esau and Jacob buried him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the records of the generations of Esau (that is, Edom).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Esau took his wives from the daughters of Canaan: Adah the daughter of Elon the Hittite, and Oholibamah the daughter of Anah and the granddaughter of Zibeon the Hivite;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also Basemath, Ishmael’s daughter, the sister of Nebaioth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Adah bore Eliphaz to Esau, and Basemath bore Reuel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Oholibamah bore Jeush and Jalam and Korah. These are the sons of Esau who were born to him in the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Esau took his wives and his sons and his daughters and all his household, and his livestock and all his cattle and all his goods which he had acquired in the land of Canaan, and went to another land away from his brother Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For their property had become too great for them to live together, and the land where they sojourned could not sustain them because of their livestock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Esau lived in the hill country of Seir; Esau is Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These then are the records of the generations of Esau the father of the Edomites in the hill country of Seir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of Esau’s sons: Eliphaz the son of Esau’s wife Adah, Reuel the son of Esau’s wife Basemath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho and Gatam and Kenaz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Timna was a concubine of Esau’s son Eliphaz and she bore Amalek to Eliphaz. These are the sons of Esau’s wife Adah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Reuel: Nahath and Zerah, Shammah and Mizzah. These were the sons of Esau’s wife Basemath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the sons of Esau’s wife Oholibamah, the daughter of Anah and the granddaughter of Zibeon: she bore to Esau, Jeush and Jalam and Korah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the chiefs of the sons of Esau. The sons of Eliphaz, the firstborn of Esau, are chief Teman, chief Omar, chief Zepho, chief Kenaz,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: chief Korah, chief Gatam, chief Amalek. These are the chiefs descended from Eliphaz in the land of Edom; these are the sons of Adah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Reuel, Esau’s son: chief Nahath, chief Zerah, chief Shammah, chief Mizzah. These are the chiefs descended from Reuel in the land of Edom; these are the sons of Esau’s wife Basemath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Esau’s wife Oholibamah: chief Jeush, chief Jalam, chief Korah. These are the chiefs descended from Esau’s wife Oholibamah, the daughter of Anah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Esau (that is, Edom), and these are their chiefs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Seir the Horite, the inhabitants of the land: Lotan and Shobal and Zibeon and Anah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Dishon and Ezer and Dishan. These are the chiefs descended from the Horites, the sons of Seir in the land of Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Lotan were Hori and Hemam; and Lotan’s sister was Timna.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Shobal: Alvan and Manahath and Ebal, Shepho and Onam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah—he is the Anah who found the hot springs in the wilderness when he was pasturing the donkeys of his father Zibeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the children of Anah: Dishon, and Oholibamah, the daughter of Anah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Dishon: Hemdan and Eshban and Ithran and Cheran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Ezer: Bilhan and Zaavan and Akan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Dishan: Uz and Aran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the chiefs descended from the Horites: chief Lotan, chief Shobal, chief Zibeon, chief Anah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: chief Dishon, chief Ezer, chief Dishan. These are the chiefs descended from the Horites, according to their various chiefs in the land of Seir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bela the son of Beor reigned in Edom, and the name of his city was Dinhabah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Bela died, and Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jobab died, and Husham of the land of the Temanites became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Husham died, and Hadad the son of Bedad, who defeated Midian in the field of Moab, became king in his place; and the name of his city was Avith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Hadad died, and Samlah of Masrekah became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Samlah died, and Shaul of Rehoboth on the Euphrates River became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Shaul died, and Baal-hanan the son of Achbor became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Baal-hanan the son of Achbor died, and Hadar became king in his place; and the name of his city was Pau; and his wife’s name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, daughter of Mezahab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the names of the chiefs descended from Esau, according to their families and their localities, by their names: chief Timna, chief Alvah, chief Jetheth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: chief Oholibamah, chief Elah, chief Pinon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: chief Kenaz, chief Teman, chief Mibzar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: chief Magdiel, chief Iram. These are the chiefs of Edom (that is, Esau, the father of the Edomites), according to their habitations in the land of their possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jacob lived in the land where his father had sojourned, in the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These are the records of the generations of Jacob.
Joseph, when seventeen years of age, was pasturing the flock with his brothers while he was still a youth, along with the sons of Bilhah and the sons of Zilpah, his father’s wives. And Joseph brought back a bad report about them to their father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Israel loved Joseph more than all his sons, because he was the son of his old age; and he made him a varicolored tunic.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His brothers saw that their father loved him more than all his brothers; and so they hated him and could not speak to him on friendly terms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph had a dream, and when he told it to his brothers, they hated him even more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Please listen to this dream which I have had;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for behold, we were binding sheaves in the field, and lo, my sheaf rose up and also stood erect; and behold, your sheaves gathered around and bowed down to my sheaf.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his brothers said to him, “Are you actually going to reign over us? Or are you really going to rule over us?” So they hated him even more for his dreams and for his words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he had still another dream, and related it to his brothers, and said, “Lo, I have had still another dream; and behold, the sun and the moon and eleven stars were bowing down to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He related it to his father and to his brothers; and his father rebuked him and said to him, “What is this dream that you have had? Shall I and your mother and your brothers actually come to bow ourselves down before you to the ground?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His brothers were jealous of him, but his father kept the saying in mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his brothers went to pasture their father’s flock in Shechem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel said to Joseph, “Are not your brothers pasturing the flock in Shechem? Come, and I will send you to them.” And he said to him, “I will go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to him, “Go now and see about the welfare of your brothers and the welfare of the flock, and bring word back to me.” So he sent him from the valley of Hebron, and he came to Shechem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man found him, and behold, he was wandering in the field; and the man asked him, “What are you looking for?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “I am looking for my brothers; please tell me where they are pasturing the flock.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the man said, “They have moved from here; for I heard them say, ‘Let us go to Dothan.’” So Joseph went after his brothers and found them at Dothan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they saw him from a distance and before he came close to them, they plotted against him to put him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to one another, “Here comes this dreamer!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now then, come and let us kill him and throw him into one of the pits; and we will say, ‘A wild beast devoured him.’ Then let us see what will become of his dreams!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Reuben heard this and rescued him out of their hands and said, “Let us not take his life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Reuben further said to them, “Shed no blood. Throw him into this pit that is in the wilderness, but do not lay hands on him”—that he might rescue him out of their hands, to restore him to his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it came about, when Joseph reached his brothers, that they stripped Joseph of his tunic, the varicolored tunic that was on him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they took him and threw him into the pit. Now the pit was empty, without any water in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they sat down to eat a meal. And as they raised their eyes and looked, behold, a caravan of Ishmaelites was coming from Gilead, with their camels bearing aromatic gum and balm and myrrh, on their way to bring them down to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah said to his brothers, “What profit is it for us to kill our brother and cover up his blood?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come and let us sell him to the Ishmaelites and not lay our hands on him, for he is our brother, our own flesh.” And his brothers listened to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some Midianite traders passed by, so they pulled him up and lifted Joseph out of the pit, and sold him to the Ishmaelites for twenty shekels of silver. Thus they brought Joseph into Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Reuben returned to the pit, and behold, Joseph was not in the pit; so he tore his garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He returned to his brothers and said, “The boy is not there; as for me, where am I to go?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took Joseph’s tunic, and slaughtered a male goat and dipped the tunic in the blood;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they sent the varicolored tunic and brought it to their father and said, “We found this; please examine it to see whether it is your son’s tunic or not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he examined it and said, “It is my son’s tunic. A wild beast has devoured him; Joseph has surely been torn to pieces!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jacob tore his clothes, and put sackcloth on his loins and mourned for his son many days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all his sons and all his daughters arose to comfort him, but he refused to be comforted. And he said, “Surely I will go down to Sheol in mourning for my son.” So his father wept for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, the Midianites sold him in Egypt to Potiphar, Pharaoh’s officer, the captain of the bodyguard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came about at that time, that Judah departed from his brothers and visited a certain Adullamite, whose name was Hirah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah saw there a daughter of a certain Canaanite whose name was Shua; and he took her and went in to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she conceived and bore a son and he named him Er.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she conceived again and bore a son and named him Onan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She bore still another son and named him Shelah; and it was at Chezib that she bore him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Judah took a wife for Er his firstborn, and her name was Tamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Er, Judah’s firstborn, was evil in the sight of the Lord, so the Lord took his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judah said to Onan, “Go in to your brother’s wife, and perform your duty as a brother-in-law to her, and raise up offspring for your brother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Onan knew that the offspring would not be his; so when he went in to his brother’s wife, he wasted his seed on the ground in order not to give offspring to his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what he did was displeasing in the sight of the Lord; so He took his life also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judah said to his daughter-in-law Tamar, “Remain a widow in your father’s house until my son Shelah grows up”; for he thought, “I am afraid that he too may die like his brothers.” So Tamar went and lived in her father’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after a considerable time Shua’s daughter, the wife of Judah, died; and when the time of mourning was ended, Judah went up to his sheepshearers at Timnah, he and his friend Hirah the Adullamite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was told to Tamar, “Behold, your father-in-law is going up to Timnah to shear his sheep.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she removed her widow’s garments and covered herself with a veil, and wrapped herself, and sat in the gateway of Enaim, which is on the road to Timnah; for she saw that Shelah had grown up, and she had not been given to him as a wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Judah saw her, he thought she was a harlot, for she had covered her face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he turned aside to her by the road, and said, “Here now, let me come in to you”; for he did not know that she was his daughter-in-law. And she said, “What will you give me, that you may come in to me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, therefore, “I will send you a young goat from the flock.” She said, moreover, “Will you give a pledge until you send it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “What pledge shall I give you?” And she said, “Your seal and your cord, and your staff that is in your hand.” So he gave them to her and went in to her, and she conceived by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she arose and departed, and removed her veil and put on her widow’s garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Judah sent the young goat by his friend the Adullamite, to receive the pledge from the woman’s hand, he did not find her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked the men of her place, saying, “Where is the temple prostitute who was by the road at Enaim?” But they said, “There has been no temple prostitute here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he returned to Judah, and said, “I did not find her; and furthermore, the men of the place said, ‘There has been no temple prostitute here.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judah said, “Let her keep them, otherwise we will become a laughingstock. After all, I sent this young goat, but you did not find her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was about three months later that Judah was informed, “Your daughter-in-law Tamar has played the harlot, and behold, she is also with child by harlotry.” Then Judah said, “Bring her out and let her be burned!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was while she was being brought out that she sent to her father-in-law, saying, “I am with child by the man to whom these things belong.” And she said, “Please examine and see, whose signet ring and cords and staff are these?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah recognized them, and said, “She is more righteous than I, inasmuch as I did not give her to my son Shelah.” And he did not have relations with her again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It came about at the time she was giving birth, that behold, there were twins in her womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, it took place while she was giving birth, one put out a hand, and the midwife took and tied a scarlet thread on his hand, saying, “This one came out first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it came about as he drew back his hand, that behold, his brother came out. Then she said, “What a breach you have made for yourself!” So he was named Perez.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward his brother came out who had the scarlet thread on his hand; and he was named Zerah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Joseph had been taken down to Egypt; and Potiphar, an Egyptian officer of Pharaoh, the captain of the bodyguard, bought him from the Ishmaelites, who had taken him down there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord was with Joseph, so he became a successful man. And he was in the house of his master, the Egyptian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now his master saw that the Lord was with him and how the Lord caused all that he did to prosper in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph found favor in his sight and became his personal servant; and he made him overseer over his house, and all that he owned he put in his charge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It came about that from the time he made him overseer in his house and over all that he owned, the Lord blessed the Egyptian’s house on account of Joseph; thus the Lord’s blessing was upon all that he owned, in the house and in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he left everything he owned in Joseph’s charge; and with him there he did not concern himself with anything except the food which he ate.
Now Joseph was handsome in form and appearance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It came about after these events that his master’s wife looked with desire at Joseph, and she said, “Lie with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he refused and said to his master’s wife, “Behold, with me here, my master does not concern himself with anything in the house, and he has put all that he owns in my charge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is no one greater in this house than I, and he has withheld nothing from me except you, because you are his wife. How then could I do this great evil and sin against God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As she spoke to Joseph day after day, he did not listen to her to lie beside her or be with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened one day that he went into the house to do his work, and none of the men of the household was there inside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She caught him by his garment, saying, “Lie with me!” And he left his garment in her hand and fled, and went outside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she saw that he had left his garment in her hand and had fled outside,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: she called to the men of her household and said to them, “See, he has brought in a Hebrew to us to make sport of us; he came in to me to lie with me, and I screamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he heard that I raised my voice and screamed, he left his garment beside me and fled and went outside.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she left his garment beside her until his master came home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she spoke to him with these words, “The Hebrew slave, whom you brought to us, came in to me to make sport of me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and as I raised my voice and screamed, he left his garment beside me and fled outside.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when his master heard the words of his wife, which she spoke to him, saying, “This is what your slave did to me,” his anger burned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph’s master took him and put him into the jail, the place where the king’s prisoners were confined; and he was there in the jail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord was with Joseph and extended kindness to him, and gave him favor in the sight of the chief jailer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief jailer committed to Joseph’s charge all the prisoners who were in the jail; so that whatever was done there, he was responsible for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief jailer did not supervise anything under Joseph’s charge because the Lord was with him; and whatever he did, the Lord made to prosper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it came about after these things, the cupbearer and the baker for the king of Egypt offended their lord, the king of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh was furious with his two officials, the chief cupbearer and the chief baker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he put them in confinement in the house of the captain of the bodyguard, in the jail, the same place where Joseph was imprisoned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The captain of the bodyguard put Joseph in charge of them, and he took care of them; and they were in confinement for some time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the cupbearer and the baker for the king of Egypt, who were confined in jail, both had a dream the same night, each man with his own dream and each dream with its own interpretation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joseph came to them in the morning and observed them, behold, they were dejected.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked Pharaoh’s officials who were with him in confinement in his master’s house, “Why are your faces so sad today?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to him, “We have had a dream and there is no one to interpret it.” Then Joseph said to them, “Do not interpretations belong to God? Tell it to me, please.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the chief cupbearer told his dream to Joseph, and said to him, “In my dream, behold, there was a vine in front of me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and on the vine were three branches. And as it was budding, its blossoms came out, and its clusters produced ripe grapes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Pharaoh’s cup was in my hand; so I took the grapes and squeezed them into Pharaoh’s cup, and I put the cup into Pharaoh’s hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph said to him, “This is the interpretation of it: the three branches are three days;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: within three more days Pharaoh will lift up your head and restore you to your office; and you will put Pharaoh’s cup into his hand according to your former custom when you were his cupbearer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only keep me in mind when it goes well with you, and please do me a kindness by mentioning me to Pharaoh and get me out of this house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I was in fact kidnapped from the land of the Hebrews, and even here I have done nothing that they should have put me into the dungeon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the chief baker saw that he had interpreted favorably, he said to Joseph, “I also saw in my dream, and behold, there were three baskets of white bread on my head;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in the top basket there were some of all sorts of baked food for Pharaoh, and the birds were eating them out of the basket on my head.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph answered and said, “This is its interpretation: the three baskets are three days;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: within three more days Pharaoh will lift up your head from you and will hang you on a tree, and the birds will eat your flesh off you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus it came about on the third day, which was Pharaoh’s birthday, that he made a feast for all his servants; and he lifted up the head of the chief cupbearer and the head of the chief baker among his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He restored the chief cupbearer to his office, and he put the cup into Pharaoh’s hand;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he hanged the chief baker, just as Joseph had interpreted to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet the chief cupbearer did not remember Joseph, but forgot him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened at the end of two full years that Pharaoh had a dream, and behold, he was standing by the Nile.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And lo, from the Nile there came up seven cows, sleek and fat; and they grazed in the marsh grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then behold, seven other cows came up after them from the Nile, ugly and gaunt, and they stood by the other cows on the bank of the Nile.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ugly and gaunt cows ate up the seven sleek and fat cows. Then Pharaoh awoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He fell asleep and dreamed a second time; and behold, seven ears of grain came up on a single stalk, plump and good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then behold, seven ears, thin and scorched by the east wind, sprouted up after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The thin ears swallowed up the seven plump and full ears. Then Pharaoh awoke, and behold, it was a dream.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the morning his spirit was troubled, so he sent and called for all the magicians of Egypt, and all its wise men. And Pharaoh told them his dreams, but there was no one who could interpret them to Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief cupbearer spoke to Pharaoh, saying, “I would make mention today of my own offenses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh was furious with his servants, and he put me in confinement in the house of the captain of the bodyguard, both me and the chief baker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We had a dream on the same night, he and I; each of us dreamed according to the interpretation of his own dream.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a Hebrew youth was with us there, a servant of the captain of the bodyguard, and we related them to him, and he interpreted our dreams for us. To each one he interpreted according to his own dream.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And just as he interpreted for us, so it happened; he restored me in my office, but he hanged him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh sent and called for Joseph, and they hurriedly brought him out of the dungeon; and when he had shaved himself and changed his clothes, he came to Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh said to Joseph, “I have had a dream, but no one can interpret it; and I have heard it said about you, that when you hear a dream you can interpret it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph then answered Pharaoh, saying, “It is not in me; God will give Pharaoh a favorable answer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pharaoh spoke to Joseph, “In my dream, behold, I was standing on the bank of the Nile;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and behold, seven cows, fat and sleek came up out of the Nile, and they grazed in the marsh grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lo, seven other cows came up after them, poor and very ugly and gaunt, such as I had never seen for ugliness in all the land of Egypt;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the lean and ugly cows ate up the first seven fat cows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet when they had devoured them, it could not be detected that they had devoured them, for they were just as ugly as before. Then I awoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I saw also in my dream, and behold, seven ears, full and good, came up on a single stalk;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and lo, seven ears, withered, thin, and scorched by the east wind, sprouted up after them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the thin ears swallowed the seven good ears. Then I told it to the magicians, but there was no one who could explain it to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Joseph said to Pharaoh, “Pharaoh’s dreams are one and the same; God has told to Pharaoh what He is about to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seven good cows are seven years; and the seven good ears are seven years; the dreams are one and the same.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seven lean and ugly cows that came up after them are seven years, and the seven thin ears scorched by the east wind will be seven years of famine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is as I have spoken to Pharaoh: God has shown to Pharaoh what He is about to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, seven years of great abundance are coming in all the land of Egypt;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and after them seven years of famine will come, and all the abundance will be forgotten in the land of Egypt, and the famine will ravage the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the abundance will be unknown in the land because of that subsequent famine; for it will be very severe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as for the repeating of the dream to Pharaoh twice, it means that the matter is determined by God, and God will quickly bring it about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now let Pharaoh look for a man discerning and wise, and set him over the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let Pharaoh take action to appoint overseers in charge of the land, and let him exact a fifth of the produce of the land of Egypt in the seven years of abundance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then let them gather all the food of these good years that are coming, and store up the grain for food in the cities under Pharaoh’s authority, and let them guard it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the food become as a reserve for the land for the seven years of famine which will occur in the land of Egypt, so that the land will not perish during the famine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the proposal seemed good to Pharaoh and to all his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh said to his servants, “Can we find a man like this, in whom is a divine spirit?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Since God has informed you of all this, there is no one so discerning and wise as you are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall be over my house, and according to your command all my people shall do homage; only in the throne I will be greater than you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh said to Joseph, “See, I have set you over all the land of Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh took off his signet ring from his hand and put it on Joseph’s hand, and clothed him in garments of fine linen and put the gold necklace around his neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had him ride in his second chariot; and they proclaimed before him, “Bow the knee!” And he set him over all the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Though I am Pharaoh, yet without your permission no one shall raise his hand or foot in all the land of Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh named Joseph Zaphenath-paneah; and he gave him Asenath, the daughter of Potiphera priest of On, as his wife. And Joseph went forth over the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Joseph was thirty years old when he stood before Pharaoh, king of Egypt. And Joseph went out from the presence of Pharaoh and went through all the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: During the seven years of plenty the land brought forth abundantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he gathered all the food of these seven years which occurred in the land of Egypt and placed the food in the cities; he placed in every city the food from its own surrounding fields.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Joseph stored up grain in great abundance like the sand of the sea, until he stopped measuring it, for it was beyond measure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now before the year of famine came, two sons were born to Joseph, whom Asenath, the daughter of Potiphera priest of On, bore to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph named the firstborn Manasseh, “For,” he said, “God has made me forget all my trouble and all my father’s household.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He named the second Ephraim, “For,” he said, “God has made me fruitful in the land of my affliction.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the seven years of plenty which had been in the land of Egypt came to an end,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the seven years of famine began to come, just as Joseph had said, then there was famine in all the lands, but in all the land of Egypt there was bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when all the land of Egypt was famished, the people cried out to Pharaoh for bread; and Pharaoh said to all the Egyptians, “Go to Joseph; whatever he says to you, you shall do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the famine was spread over all the face of the earth, then Joseph opened all the storehouses, and sold to the Egyptians; and the famine was severe in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of all the earth came to Egypt to buy grain from Joseph, because the famine was severe in all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jacob saw that there was grain in Egypt, and Jacob said to his sons, “Why are you staring at one another?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Behold, I have heard that there is grain in Egypt; go down there and buy some for us from that place, so that we may live and not die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then ten brothers of Joseph went down to buy grain from Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jacob did not send Joseph’s brother Benjamin with his brothers, for he said, “I am afraid that harm may befall him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the sons of Israel came to buy grain among those who were coming, for the famine was in the land of Canaan also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Joseph was the ruler over the land; he was the one who sold to all the people of the land. And Joseph’s brothers came and bowed down to him with their faces to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joseph saw his brothers he recognized them, but he disguised himself to them and spoke to them harshly. And he said to them, “Where have you come from?” And they said, “From the land of Canaan, to buy food.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Joseph had recognized his brothers, although they did not recognize him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph remembered the dreams which he had about them, and said to them, “You are spies; you have come to look at the undefended parts of our land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to him, “No, my lord, but your servants have come to buy food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are all sons of one man; we are honest men, your servants are not spies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet he said to them, “No, but you have come to look at the undefended parts of our land!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they said, “Your servants are twelve brothers in all, the sons of one man in the land of Canaan; and behold, the youngest is with our father today, and one is no longer alive.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph said to them, “It is as I said to you, you are spies;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by this you will be tested: by the life of Pharaoh, you shall not go from this place unless your youngest brother comes here!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Send one of you that he may get your brother, while you remain confined, that your words may be tested, whether there is truth in you. But if not, by the life of Pharaoh, surely you are spies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he put them all together in prison for three days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Joseph said to them on the third day, “Do this and live, for I fear God:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if you are honest men, let one of your brothers be confined in your prison; but as for the rest of you, go, carry grain for the famine of your households,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and bring your youngest brother to me, so your words may be verified, and you will not die.” And they did so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to one another, “Truly we are guilty concerning our brother, because we saw the distress of his soul when he pleaded with us, yet we would not listen; therefore this distress has come upon us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Reuben answered them, saying, “Did I not tell you, ‘Do not sin against the boy’; and you would not listen? Now comes the reckoning for his blood.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did not know, however, that Joseph understood, for there was an interpreter between them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He turned away from them and wept. But when he returned to them and spoke to them, he took Simeon from them and bound him before their eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph gave orders to fill their bags with grain and to restore every man’s money in his sack, and to give them provisions for the journey. And thus it was done for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they loaded their donkeys with their grain and departed from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As one of them opened his sack to give his donkey fodder at the lodging place, he saw his money; and behold, it was in the mouth of his sack.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to his brothers, “My money has been returned, and behold, it is even in my sack.” And their hearts sank, and they turned trembling to one another, saying, “What is this that God has done to us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to their father Jacob in the land of Canaan, they told him all that had happened to them, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The man, the lord of the land, spoke harshly with us, and took us for spies of the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we said to him, ‘We are honest men; we are not spies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are twelve brothers, sons of our father; one is no longer alive, and the youngest is with our father today in the land of Canaan.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man, the lord of the land, said to us, ‘By this I will know that you are honest men: leave one of your brothers with me and take grain for the famine of your households, and go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But bring your youngest brother to me that I may know that you are not spies, but honest men. I will give your brother to you, and you may trade in the land.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came about as they were emptying their sacks, that behold, every man’s bundle of money was in his sack; and when they and their father saw their bundles of money, they were dismayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their father Jacob said to them, “You have bereaved me of my children: Joseph is no more, and Simeon is no more, and you would take Benjamin; all these things are against me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Reuben spoke to his father, saying, “You may put my two sons to death if I do not bring him back to you; put him in my care, and I will return him to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jacob said, “My son shall not go down with you; for his brother is dead, and he alone is left. If harm should befall him on the journey you are taking, then you will bring my gray hair down to Sheol in sorrow.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the famine was severe in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it came about when they had finished eating the grain which they had brought from Egypt, that their father said to them, “Go back, buy us a little food.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah spoke to him, however, saying, “The man solemnly warned us, ‘You shall not see my face unless your brother is with you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you send our brother with us, we will go down and buy you food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you do not send him, we will not go down; for the man said to us, ‘You will not see my face unless your brother is with you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Israel said, “Why did you treat me so badly by telling the man whether you still had another brother?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they said, “The man questioned particularly about us and our relatives, saying, ‘Is your father still alive? Have you another brother?’ So we answered his questions. Could we possibly know that he would say, ‘Bring your brother down’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah said to his father Israel, “Send the lad with me and we will arise and go, that we may live and not die, we as well as you and our little ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I myself will be surety for him; you may hold me responsible for him. If I do not bring him back to you and set him before you, then let me bear the blame before you forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if we had not delayed, surely by now we could have returned twice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then their father Israel said to them, “If it must be so, then do this: take some of the best products of the land in your bags, and carry down to the man as a present, a little balm and a little honey, aromatic gum and myrrh, pistachio nuts and almonds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take double the money in your hand, and take back in your hand the money that was returned in the mouth of your sacks; perhaps it was a mistake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take your brother also, and arise, return to the man;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and may God Almighty grant you compassion in the sight of the man, so that he will release to you your other brother and Benjamin. And as for me, if I am bereaved of my children, I am bereaved.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the men took this present, and they took double the money in their hand, and Benjamin; then they arose and went down to Egypt and stood before Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joseph saw Benjamin with them, he said to his house steward, “Bring the men into the house, and slay an animal and make ready; for the men are to dine with me at noon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the man did as Joseph said, and brought the men to Joseph’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the men were afraid, because they were brought to Joseph’s house; and they said, “It is because of the money that was returned in our sacks the first time that we are being brought in, that he may seek occasion against us and fall upon us, and take us for slaves with our donkeys.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they came near to Joseph’s house steward, and spoke to him at the entrance of the house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “Oh, my lord, we indeed came down the first time to buy food,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it came about when we came to the lodging place, that we opened our sacks, and behold, each man’s money was in the mouth of his sack, our money in full. So we have brought it back in our hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have also brought down other money in our hand to buy food; we do not know who put our money in our sacks.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Be at ease, do not be afraid. Your God and the God of your father has given you treasure in your sacks; I had your money.” Then he brought Simeon out to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the man brought the men into Joseph’s house and gave them water, and they washed their feet; and he gave their donkeys fodder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they prepared the present for Joseph’s coming at noon; for they had heard that they were to eat a meal there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joseph came home, they brought into the house to him the present which was in their hand and bowed to the ground before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he asked them about their welfare, and said, “Is your old father well, of whom you spoke? Is he still alive?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Your servant our father is well; he is still alive.” They bowed down in homage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he lifted his eyes and saw his brother Benjamin, his mother’s son, he said, “Is this your youngest brother, of whom you spoke to me?” And he said, “May God be gracious to you, my son.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph hurried out for he was deeply stirred over his brother, and he sought a place to weep; and he entered his chamber and wept there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he washed his face and came out; and he controlled himself and said, “Serve the meal.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they served him by himself, and them by themselves, and the Egyptians who ate with him by themselves, because the Egyptians could not eat bread with the Hebrews, for that is loathsome to the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now they were seated before him, the firstborn according to his birthright and the youngest according to his youth, and the men looked at one another in astonishment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took portions to them from his own table, but Benjamin’s portion was five times as much as any of theirs. So they feasted and drank freely with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he commanded his house steward, saying, “Fill the men’s sacks with food, as much as they can carry, and put each man’s money in the mouth of his sack.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Put my cup, the silver cup, in the mouth of the sack of the youngest, and his money for the grain.” And he did as Joseph had told him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as it was light, the men were sent away, they with their donkeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had just gone out of the city, and were not far off, when Joseph said to his house steward, “Up, follow the men; and when you overtake them, say to them, ‘Why have you repaid evil for good?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not this the one from which my lord drinks and which he indeed uses for divination? You have done wrong in doing this.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he overtook them and spoke these words to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “Why does my lord speak such words as these? Far be it from your servants to do such a thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, the money which we found in the mouth of our sacks we have brought back to you from the land of Canaan. How then could we steal silver or gold from your lord’s house?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With whomever of your servants it is found, let him die, and we also will be my lord’s slaves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said, “Now let it also be according to your words; he with whom it is found shall be my slave, and the rest of you shall be innocent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they hurried, each man lowered his sack to the ground, and each man opened his sack.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He searched, beginning with the oldest and ending with the youngest, and the cup was found in Benjamin’s sack.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they tore their clothes, and when each man loaded his donkey, they returned to the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Judah and his brothers came to Joseph’s house, he was still there, and they fell to the ground before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph said to them, “What is this deed that you have done? Do you not know that such a man as I can indeed practice divination?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Judah said, “What can we say to my lord? What can we speak? And how can we justify ourselves? God has found out the iniquity of your servants; behold, we are my lord’s slaves, both we and the one in whose possession the cup has been found.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, “Far be it from me to do this. The man in whose possession the cup has been found, he shall be my slave; but as for you, go up in peace to your father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judah approached him, and said, “Oh my lord, may your servant please speak a word in my lord’s ears, and do not be angry with your servant; for you are equal to Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My lord asked his servants, saying, ‘Have you a father or a brother?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We said to my lord, ‘We have an old father and a little child of his old age. Now his brother is dead, so he alone is left of his mother, and his father loves him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you said to your servants, ‘Bring him down to me that I may set my eyes on him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we said to my lord, ‘The lad cannot leave his father, for if he should leave his father, his father would die.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You said to your servants, however, ‘Unless your youngest brother comes down with you, you will not see my face again.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus it came about when we went up to your servant my father, we told him the words of my lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our father said, ‘Go back, buy us a little food.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we said, ‘We cannot go down. If our youngest brother is with us, then we will go down; for we cannot see the man’s face unless our youngest brother is with us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your servant my father said to us, ‘You know that my wife bore me two sons;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the one went out from me, and I said, “Surely he is torn in pieces,” and I have not seen him since.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you take this one also from me, and harm befalls him, you will bring my gray hair down to Sheol in sorrow.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, therefore, when I come to your servant my father, and the lad is not with us, since his life is bound up in the lad’s life,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when he sees that the lad is not with us, he will die. Thus your servants will bring the gray hair of your servant our father down to Sheol in sorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For your servant became surety for the lad to my father, saying, ‘If I do not bring him back to you, then let me bear the blame before my father forever.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, therefore, please let your servant remain instead of the lad a slave to my lord, and let the lad go up with his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For how shall I go up to my father if the lad is not with me—for fear that I see the evil that would overtake my father?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph could not control himself before all those who stood by him, and he cried, “Have everyone go out from me.” So there was no man with him when Joseph made himself known to his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He wept so loudly that the Egyptians heard it, and the household of Pharaoh heard of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph said to his brothers, “I am Joseph! Is my father still alive?” But his brothers could not answer him, for they were dismayed at his presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph said to his brothers, “Please come closer to me.” And they came closer. And he said, “I am your brother Joseph, whom you sold into Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now do not be grieved or angry with yourselves, because you sold me here, for God sent me before you to preserve life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the famine has been in the land these two years, and there are still five years in which there will be neither plowing nor harvesting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God sent me before you to preserve for you a remnant in the earth, and to keep you alive by a great deliverance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, therefore, it was not you who sent me here, but God; and He has made me a father to Pharaoh and lord of all his household and ruler over all the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hurry and go up to my father, and say to him, ‘Thus says your son Joseph, “God has made me lord of all Egypt; come down to me, do not delay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall live in the land of Goshen, and you shall be near me, you and your children and your children’s children and your flocks and your herds and all that you have.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There I will also provide for you, for there are still five years of famine to come, and you and your household and all that you have would be impoverished.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, your eyes see, and the eyes of my brother Benjamin see, that it is my mouth which is speaking to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now you must tell my father of all my splendor in Egypt, and all that you have seen; and you must hurry and bring my father down here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he fell on his brother Benjamin’s neck and wept, and Benjamin wept on his neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He kissed all his brothers and wept on them, and afterward his brothers talked with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the news was heard in Pharaoh’s house that Joseph’s brothers had come, it pleased Pharaoh and his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Say to your brothers, ‘Do this: load your beasts and go to the land of Canaan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and take your father and your households and come to me, and I will give you the best of the land of Egypt and you will eat the fat of the land.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now you are ordered, ‘Do this: take wagons from the land of Egypt for your little ones and for your wives, and bring your father and come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not concern yourselves with your goods, for the best of all the land of Egypt is yours.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the sons of Israel did so; and Joseph gave them wagons according to the command of Pharaoh, and gave them provisions for the journey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To each of them he gave changes of garments, but to Benjamin he gave three hundred pieces of silver and five changes of garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To his father he sent as follows: ten donkeys loaded with the best things of Egypt, and ten female donkeys loaded with grain and bread and sustenance for his father on the journey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he sent his brothers away, and as they departed, he said to them, “Do not quarrel on the journey.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they went up from Egypt, and came to the land of Canaan to their father Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told him, saying, “Joseph is still alive, and indeed he is ruler over all the land of Egypt.” But he was stunned, for he did not believe them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they told him all the words of Joseph that he had spoken to them, and when he saw the wagons that Joseph had sent to carry him, the spirit of their father Jacob revived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Israel said, “It is enough; my son Joseph is still alive. I will go and see him before I die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Israel set out with all that he had, and came to Beersheba, and offered sacrifices to the God of his father Isaac.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God spoke to Israel in visions of the night and said, “Jacob, Jacob.” And he said, “Here I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “I am God, the God of your father; do not be afraid to go down to Egypt, for I will make you a great nation there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will go down with you to Egypt, and I will also surely bring you up again; and Joseph will close your eyes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob arose from Beersheba; and the sons of Israel carried their father Jacob and their little ones and their wives in the wagons which Pharaoh had sent to carry him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took their livestock and their property, which they had acquired in the land of Canaan, and came to Egypt, Jacob and all his descendants with him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his sons and his grandsons with him, his daughters and his granddaughters, and all his descendants he brought with him to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the names of the sons of Israel, Jacob and his sons, who went to Egypt: Reuben, Jacob’s firstborn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Reuben: Hanoch and Pallu and Hezron and Carmi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Simeon: Jemuel and Jamin and Ohad and Jachin and Zohar and Shaul the son of a Canaanite woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Judah: Er and Onan and Shelah and Perez and Zerah (but Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan). And the sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Issachar: Tola and Puvvah and Iob and Shimron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Zebulun: Sered and Elon and Jahleel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Leah, whom she bore to Jacob in Paddan-aram, with his daughter Dinah; all his sons and his daughters numbered thirty-three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Gad: Ziphion and Haggi, Shuni and Ezbon, Eri and Arodi and Areli.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Asher: Imnah and Ishvah and Ishvi and Beriah and their sister Serah. And the sons of Beriah: Heber and Malchiel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Zilpah, whom Laban gave to his daughter Leah; and she bore to Jacob these sixteen persons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Jacob’s wife Rachel: Joseph and Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now to Joseph in the land of Egypt were born Manasseh and Ephraim, whom Asenath, the daughter of Potiphera, priest of On, bore to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Benjamin: Bela and Becher and Ashbel, Gera and Naaman, Ehi and Rosh, Muppim and Huppim and Ard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Rachel, who were born to Jacob; there were fourteen persons in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Dan: Hushim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Naphtali: Jahzeel and Guni and Jezer and Shillem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Bilhah, whom Laban gave to his daughter Rachel, and she bore these to Jacob; there were seven persons in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the persons belonging to Jacob, who came to Egypt, his direct descendants, not including the wives of Jacob’s sons, were sixty-six persons in all,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sons of Joseph, who were born to him in Egypt were two; all the persons of the house of Jacob, who came to Egypt, were seventy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he sent Judah before him to Joseph, to point out the way before him to Goshen; and they came into the land of Goshen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph prepared his chariot and went up to Goshen to meet his father Israel; as soon as he appeared before him, he fell on his neck and wept on his neck a long time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Israel said to Joseph, “Now let me die, since I have seen your face, that you are still alive.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph said to his brothers and to his father’s household, “I will go up and tell Pharaoh, and will say to him, ‘My brothers and my father’s household, who were in the land of Canaan, have come to me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the men are shepherds, for they have been keepers of livestock; and they have brought their flocks and their herds and all that they have.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pharaoh calls you and says, ‘What is your occupation?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall say, ‘Your servants have been keepers of livestock from our youth even until now, both we and our fathers,’ that you may live in the land of Goshen; for every shepherd is loathsome to the Egyptians.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph went in and told Pharaoh, and said, “My father and my brothers and their flocks and their herds and all that they have, have come out of the land of Canaan; and behold, they are in the land of Goshen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took five men from among his brothers and presented them to Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh said to his brothers, “What is your occupation?” So they said to Pharaoh, “Your servants are shepherds, both we and our fathers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Pharaoh, “We have come to sojourn in the land, for there is no pasture for your servants’ flocks, for the famine is severe in the land of Canaan. Now, therefore, please let your servants live in the land of Goshen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Your father and your brothers have come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land of Egypt is at your disposal; settle your father and your brothers in the best of the land, let them live in the land of Goshen; and if you know any capable men among them, then put them in charge of my livestock.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph brought his father Jacob and presented him to Pharaoh; and Jacob blessed Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh said to Jacob, “How many years have you lived?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jacob said to Pharaoh, “The years of my sojourning are one hundred and thirty; few and unpleasant have been the years of my life, nor have they attained the years that my fathers lived during the days of their sojourning.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob blessed Pharaoh, and went out from his presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph settled his father and his brothers and gave them a possession in the land of Egypt, in the best of the land, in the land of Rameses, as Pharaoh had ordered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph provided his father and his brothers and all his father’s household with food, according to their little ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was no food in all the land, because the famine was very severe, so that the land of Egypt and the land of Canaan languished because of the famine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph gathered all the money that was found in the land of Egypt and in the land of Canaan for the grain which they bought, and Joseph brought the money into Pharaoh’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the money was all spent in the land of Egypt and in the land of Canaan, all the Egyptians came to Joseph and said, “Give us food, for why should we die in your presence? For our money is gone.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph said, “Give up your livestock, and I will give you food for your livestock, since your money is gone.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they brought their livestock to Joseph, and Joseph gave them food in exchange for the horses and the flocks and the herds and the donkeys; and he fed them with food in exchange for all their livestock that year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When that year was ended, they came to him the next year and said to him, “We will not hide from my lord that our money is all spent, and the cattle are my lord’s. There is nothing left for my lord except our bodies and our lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why should we die before your eyes, both we and our land? Buy us and our land for food, and we and our land will be slaves to Pharaoh. So give us seed, that we may live and not die, and that the land may not be desolate.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph bought all the land of Egypt for Pharaoh, for every Egyptian sold his field, because the famine was severe upon them. Thus the land became Pharaoh’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the people, he removed them to the cities from one end of Egypt’s border to the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only the land of the priests he did not buy, for the priests had an allotment from Pharaoh, and they lived off the allotment which Pharaoh gave them. Therefore, they did not sell their land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph said to the people, “Behold, I have today bought you and your land for Pharaoh; now, here is seed for you, and you may sow the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the harvest you shall give a fifth to Pharaoh, and four-fifths shall be your own for seed of the field and for your food and for those of your households and as food for your little ones.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said, “You have saved our lives! Let us find favor in the sight of my lord, and we will be Pharaoh’s slaves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph made it a statute concerning the land of Egypt valid to this day, that Pharaoh should have the fifth; only the land of the priests did not become Pharaoh’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Israel lived in the land of Egypt, in Goshen, and they acquired property in it and were fruitful and became very numerous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob lived in the land of Egypt seventeen years; so the length of Jacob’s life was one hundred and forty-seven years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the time for Israel to die drew near, he called his son Joseph and said to him, “Please, if I have found favor in your sight, place now your hand under my thigh and deal with me in kindness and faithfulness. Please do not bury me in Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when I lie down with my fathers, you shall carry me out of Egypt and bury me in their burial place.” And he said, “I will do as you have said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Swear to me.” So he swore to him. Then Israel bowed in worship at the head of the bed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came about after these things that Joseph was told, “Behold, your father is sick.” So he took his two sons Manasseh and Ephraim with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was told to Jacob, “Behold, your son Joseph has come to you,” Israel collected his strength and sat up in the bed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob said to Joseph, “God Almighty appeared to me at Luz in the land of Canaan and blessed me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and He said to me, ‘Behold, I will make you fruitful and numerous, and I will make you a company of peoples, and will give this land to your descendants after you for an everlasting possession.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now your two sons, who were born to you in the land of Egypt before I came to you in Egypt, are mine; Ephraim and Manasseh shall be mine, as Reuben and Simeon are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But your offspring that have been born after them shall be yours; they shall be called by the names of their brothers in their inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as for me, when I came from Paddan, Rachel died, to my sorrow, in the land of Canaan on the journey, when there was still some distance to go to Ephrath; and I buried her there on the way to Ephrath (that is, Bethlehem).”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Israel saw Joseph’s sons, he said, “Who are these?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph said to his father, “They are my sons, whom God has given me here.” So he said, “Bring them to me, please, that I may bless them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the eyes of Israel were so dim from age that he could not see. Then Joseph brought them close to him, and he kissed them and embraced them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel said to Joseph, “I never expected to see your face, and behold, God has let me see your children as well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph took them from his knees, and bowed with his face to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph took them both, Ephraim with his right hand toward Israel’s left, and Manasseh with his left hand toward Israel’s right, and brought them close to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Israel stretched out his right hand and laid it on the head of Ephraim, who was the younger, and his left hand on Manasseh’s head, crossing his hands, although Manasseh was the firstborn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He blessed Joseph, and said,
“The God before whom my fathers Abraham and Isaac walked,
The God who has been my shepherd all my life to this day,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
