verses.text: When Joseph saw that his father laid his right hand on Ephraim’s head, it displeased him; and he grasped his father’s hand to remove it from Ephraim’s head to Manasseh’s head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph said to his father, “Not so, my father, for this one is the firstborn. Place your right hand on his head.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his father refused and said, “I know, my son, I know; he also will become a people and he also will be great. However, his younger brother shall be greater than he, and his descendants shall become a multitude of nations.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He blessed them that day, saying,
“By you Israel will pronounce blessing, saying,
‘May God make you like Ephraim and Manasseh!’”
Thus he put Ephraim before Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Israel said to Joseph, “Behold, I am about to die, but God will be with you, and bring you back to the land of your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I give you one portion more than your brothers, which I took from the hand of the Amorite with my sword and my bow.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob summoned his sons and said, “Assemble yourselves that I may tell you what will befall you in the days to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Gather together and hear, O sons of Jacob;
And listen to Israel your father.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Simeon and Levi are brothers;
Their swords are implements of violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Cursed be their anger, for it is fierce;
And their wrath, for it is cruel.
I will disperse them in Jacob,
And scatter them in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Judah is a lion’s whelp;
From the prey, my son, you have gone up.
He couches, he lies down as a lion,
And as a lion, who dares rouse him up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The scepter shall not depart from Judah,
Nor the ruler’s staff from between his feet,
Until Shiloh comes,
And to him shall be the obedience of the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“He ties his foal to the vine,
And his donkey’s colt to the choice vine;
He washes his garments in wine,
And his robes in the blood of grapes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“His eyes are dull from wine,
And his teeth white from milk.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Issachar is a strong donkey,
Lying down between the sheepfolds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“When he saw that a resting place was good
And that the land was pleasant,
He bowed his shoulder to bear burdens,
And became a slave at forced labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Dan shall judge his people,
As one of the tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Dan shall be a serpent in the way,
A horned snake in the path,
That bites the horse’s heels,
So that his rider falls backward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For Your salvation I wait, O Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“As for Gad, raiders shall raid him,
But he will raid at their heels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“As for Asher, his food shall be rich,
And he will yield royal dainties.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Naphtali is a doe let loose,
He gives beautiful words.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“The archers bitterly attacked him,
And shot at him and harassed him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But his bow remained firm,
And his arms were agile,
From the hands of the Mighty One of Jacob
(From there is the Shepherd, the Stone of Israel),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the God of your father who helps you,
And by the Almighty who blesses you
With blessings of heaven above,
Blessings of the deep that lies beneath,
Blessings of the breasts and of the womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The blessings of your father
Have surpassed the blessings of my ancestors
Up to the utmost bound of the everlasting hills;
May they be on the head of Joseph,
And on the crown of the head of the one distinguished among his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: All these are the twelve tribes of Israel, and this is what their father said to them when he blessed them. He blessed them, every one with the blessing appropriate to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he charged them and said to them, “I am about to be gathered to my people; bury me with my fathers in the cave that is in the field of Ephron the Hittite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the cave that is in the field of Machpelah, which is before Mamre, in the land of Canaan, which Abraham bought along with the field from Ephron the Hittite for a burial site.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There they buried Abraham and his wife Sarah, there they buried Isaac and his wife Rebekah, and there I buried Leah—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the field and the cave that is in it, purchased from the sons of Heth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jacob finished charging his sons, he drew his feet into the bed and breathed his last, and was gathered to his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph fell on his father’s face, and wept over him and kissed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph commanded his servants the physicians to embalm his father. So the physicians embalmed Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now forty days were required for it, for such is the period required for embalming. And the Egyptians wept for him seventy days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the days of mourning for him were past, Joseph spoke to the household of Pharaoh, saying, “If now I have found favor in your sight, please speak to Pharaoh, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘My father made me swear, saying, “Behold, I am about to die; in my grave which I dug for myself in the land of Canaan, there you shall bury me.” Now therefore, please let me go up and bury my father; then I will return.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh said, “Go up and bury your father, as he made you swear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph went up to bury his father, and with him went up all the servants of Pharaoh, the elders of his household and all the elders of the land of Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the household of Joseph and his brothers and his father’s household; they left only their little ones and their flocks and their herds in the land of Goshen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There also went up with him both chariots and horsemen; and it was a very great company.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to the threshing floor of Atad, which is beyond the Jordan, they lamented there with a very great and sorrowful lamentation; and he observed seven days mourning for his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the inhabitants of the land, the Canaanites, saw the mourning at the threshing floor of Atad, they said, “This is a grievous mourning for the Egyptians.” Therefore it was named Abel-mizraim, which is beyond the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus his sons did for him as he had charged them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for his sons carried him to the land of Canaan and buried him in the cave of the field of Machpelah before Mamre, which Abraham had bought along with the field for a burial site from Ephron the Hittite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he had buried his father, Joseph returned to Egypt, he and his brothers, and all who had gone up with him to bury his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joseph’s brothers saw that their father was dead, they said, “What if Joseph bears a grudge against us and pays us back in full for all the wrong which we did to him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they sent a message to Joseph, saying, “Your father charged before he died, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Thus you shall say to Joseph, “Please forgive, I beg you, the transgression of your brothers and their sin, for they did you wrong.”’ And now, please forgive the transgression of the servants of the God of your father.” And Joseph wept when they spoke to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his brothers also came and fell down before him and said, “Behold, we are your servants.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Joseph said to them, “Do not be afraid, for am I in God’s place?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for you, you meant evil against me, but God meant it for good in order to bring about this present result, to preserve many people alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So therefore, do not be afraid; I will provide for you and your little ones.” So he comforted them and spoke kindly to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Joseph stayed in Egypt, he and his father’s household, and Joseph lived one hundred and ten years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph saw the third generation of Ephraim’s sons; also the sons of Machir, the son of Manasseh, were born on Joseph’s knees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph said to his brothers, “I am about to die, but God will surely take care of you and bring you up from this land to the land which He promised on oath to Abraham, to Isaac and to Jacob.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph made the sons of Israel swear, saying, “God will surely take care of you, and you shall carry my bones up from here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph died at the age of one hundred and ten years; and he was embalmed and placed in a coffin in Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator
